Events.text: Hugh of Provence abdicates the throne in favor of his son Lothair II who is acclaimed sole king of Italy.
Events.html: Hugh of Provence abdicates the throne in favor of his son Lothair II who is acclaimed sole king of Italy.

Events.text: Henry V is crowned Holy Roman Emperor.
Events.html: Henry V is crowned Holy Roman Emperor.

Events.text: Constantinople falls to the Crusaders of the Fourth Crusade, temporarily ending the Byzantine Empire.
Events.html: Constantinople falls to the Crusaders of the Fourth Crusade, temporarily ending the Byzantine Empire.

Events.text: Miyamoto Musashi defeats Sasaki Kojirō at Funajima island.
Events.html: Miyamoto Musashi defeats Sasaki Kojirō at Funajima island.

Events.text: Samuel Argall captures Native American princess Pocahontas in Passapatanzy, Virginia to ransom her for some English prisoners held by her father; she is brought to Henricus as hostage.
Events.html: Samuel Argall captures Native American princess Pocahontas in Passapatanzy, Virginia to ransom her for some English prisoners held by her father; she is brought to Henricus as hostage.

Events.text: Guru Gobind Singh establishes the Khalsa in Anandpur Sahib, Punjab.
Events.html: Guru Gobind Singh establishes the Khalsa in Anandpur Sahib, Punjab.

Events.text: George Frideric Handel's oratorio Messiah makes its world-premiere in Dublin, Ireland.
Events.html: George Frideric Handel's oratorio Messiah makes its world-premiere in Dublin, Ireland.

Events.text: American Revolutionary War: American forces are ambushed and defeated in the Battle of Bound Brook, New Jersey.
Events.html: American Revolutionary War: American forces are ambushed and defeated in the Battle of Bound Brook, New Jersey.

Events.text: The Roman Catholic Relief Act 1829 gives Roman Catholics in the United Kingdom the right to vote and to sit in Parliament.
Events.html: The Roman Catholic Relief Act 1829 gives Roman Catholics in the United Kingdom the right to vote and to sit in Parliament.

links.title: Roman Catholicism in the United Kingdom

Events.text: Lajos Kossuth presents the Hungarian Declaration of Independence in a closed session of the National Assembly.
Events.html: Lajos Kossuth presents the Hungarian Declaration of Independence in a closed session of the National Assembly.

Events.text: American Civil War: Fort Sumter surrenders to Confederate forces.
Events.html: American Civil War: Fort Sumter surrenders to Confederate forces.

Events.text: American Civil War: Raleigh, North Carolina is occupied by Union Forces.
Events.html: American Civil War: Raleigh, North Carolina is occupied by Union Forces.

Events.text: The New York City Metropolitan Museum of Art is founded.
Events.html: The New York City Metropolitan Museum of Art is founded.

Events.text: The Colfax massacre, in which more than 60 African Americans are murdered, takes place.
Events.html: The Colfax massacre, in which more than 60 African Americans are murdered, takes place.

Events.text: James C. Penney opens his first store in Kemmerer, Wyoming.
Events.html: James C. Penney opens his first store in Kemmerer, Wyoming.

Events.text: The military of the Ottoman Empire reverses the Ottoman countercoup of 1909 to force the overthrow of Sultan Abdul Hamid II.
Events.html: The military of the Ottoman Empire reverses the Ottoman countercoup of 1909 to force the overthrow of Sultan Abdul Hamid II.

Events.text: The Provisional Government of the Republic of Korea is established.
Events.html: The Provisional Government of the Republic of Korea is established.

links.title: Provisional Government of the Republic of Korea

Events.text: Jallianwala Bagh massacre: British troops gun down at least 379 unarmed demonstrators in Amritsar, India; at least 1200 are wounded.
Events.html: 1919 – Jallianwala Bagh massacre: British troops gun down at least 379 unarmed demonstrators in Amritsar, India; at least 1200 are wounded.

Events.text: Eugene V. Debs is imprisoned at the Atlanta Federal Penitentiary in Atlanta, Georgia, for speaking out against the draft during World War I.
Events.html: 1919 – Eugene V. Debs is imprisoned at the Atlanta Federal Penitentiary in Atlanta, Georgia, for speaking out against the draft during World War I.

Events.text: A Pact of neutrality between the USSR and Japan is signed.
Events.html: A Pact of neutrality between the USSR and Japan is signed.

Events.text: World War II: The discovery of mass graves of Polish prisoners of war killed by Soviet forces in the Katyń Forest Massacre is announced, causing a diplomatic rift between the Polish government-in-exile in London from the Soviet Union, which denies responsibility.
Events.html: World War II: The discovery of mass graves of Polish prisoners of war killed by Soviet forces in the Katyń Forest Massacre is announced, causing a diplomatic rift between the Polish government-in-exile in London from the Soviet Union, which denies responsibility.

Events.text: The Jefferson Memorial is dedicated in Washington, D.C., on the 200th anniversary of President Thomas Jefferson's birth.
Events.html: 1943 – The Jefferson Memorial is dedicated in Washington, D.C., on the 200th anniversary of President Thomas Jefferson's birth.

Events.text: Diplomatic relations between New Zealand and the Soviet Union are established.
Events.html: Diplomatic relations between New Zealand and the Soviet Union are established.

Events.text: World War II: German troops kill more than 1,000 political and military prisoners in Gardelegen, Germany.
Events.html: World War II: German troops kill more than 1,000 political and military prisoners in Gardelegen, Germany.

Events.text: World War II: Soviet and Bulgarian forces capture Vienna.
Events.html: 1945 – World War II: Soviet and Bulgarian forces capture Vienna.

Events.text: In an ambush, 78 Jewish doctors, nurses and medical students from Hadassah Hospital, and a British soldier, are massacred by Arabs in Sheikh Jarrah.
Events.html: In an ambush, 78 Jewish doctors, nurses and medical students from Hadassah Hospital, and a British soldier, are massacred by Arabs in Sheikh Jarrah.

Events.text: CIA director Allen Dulles launches the mind-control program Project MKUltra.
Events.html: CIA director Allen Dulles launches the mind-control program Project MKUltra.

Events.text: The United States launches Transit 1-B, the world's first satellite navigation system.
Events.html: The United States launches Transit 1-B, the world's first satellite navigation system.

Events.text: At the Academy Awards, Sidney Poitier becomes the first African-American male to win the Best Actor award for the 1963 film Lilies of the Field.
Events.html: At the Academy Awards, Sidney Poitier becomes the first African-American male to win the Best Actor award for the 1963 film Lilies of the Field.

Events.text: An oxygen tank aboard Apollo 13 explodes, putting the crew in great danger and causing major damage to the spacecraft while en route to the Moon.
Events.html: An oxygen tank aboard Apollo 13 explodes, putting the crew in great danger and causing major damage to the spacecraft while en route to the Moon.

Events.text: The Universal Postal Union decides to recognize the People's Republic of China as the only legitimate Chinese representative, effectively expelling the Republic of China administering Taiwan.
Events.html: The Universal Postal Union decides to recognize the People's Republic of China as the only legitimate Chinese representative, effectively expelling the Republic of China administering Taiwan.

Events.text: Vietnam War: The Battle of An Lộc begins.
Events.html: 1972 – Vietnam War: The Battle of An Lộc begins.

Events.text: Western Union (in cooperation with NASA and Hughes Aircraft) launches the United States' first commercial geosynchronous communications satellite, Westar 1.
Events.html: Western Union (in cooperation with NASA and Hughes Aircraft) launches the United States' first commercial geosynchronous communications satellite, Westar 1.

Events.text: An attack by the Phalangist resistance kills 26 militia members of the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine, marking the start of the 15-year Lebanese Civil War.
Events.html: An attack by the Phalangist resistance kills 26 militia members of the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine, marking the start of the 15-year Lebanese Civil War.

links.title: Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine

Events.text: The United States Treasury Department reintroduces the two-dollar bill as a Federal Reserve Note on Thomas Jefferson's 233rd birthday as part of the United States Bicentennial celebration.
Events.html: The United States Treasury Department reintroduces the two-dollar bill as a Federal Reserve Note on Thomas Jefferson's 233rd birthday as part of the United States Bicentennial celebration.

Events.text: Forty workers die in an explosion at the Lapua ammunition factory, the deadliest accidental disaster in modern history in Finland.
Events.html: Forty workers die in an explosion at the Lapua ammunition factory, the deadliest accidental disaster in modern history in Finland.

Events.text: Portugal and the People's Republic of China sign an agreement in which Macau would be returned to China in 1999.
Events.html: Portugal and the People's Republic of China sign an agreement in which Macau would be returned to China in 1999.

Events.text: Basements throughout the Chicago Loop are flooded, forcing the Chicago Board of Trade Building and the Chicago Mercantile Exchange to close.
Events.html: Basements throughout the Chicago Loop are flooded, forcing the Chicago Board of Trade Building and the Chicago Mercantile Exchange to close.

Events.text: Tiger Woods becomes the youngest golfer to win the Masters Tournament.
Events.html: Tiger Woods becomes the youngest golfer to win the Masters Tournament.

Events.text: The US drops the largest ever non-nuclear weapon on Nangarhar Province, Afghanistan.
Events.html: The US drops the largest ever non-nuclear weapon on Nangarhar Province, Afghanistan.
